com.salesforce.omakase.ast.declaration

Class Declaration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.AbstractSyntax
      • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.collection.AbstractGroupable<Rule,Declaration>
        • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.declaration.Declaration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Groupable<Rule,Declaration>, Named, Refinable, Syntax, Broadcastable, Writable

    public final class Declaration
extends AbstractGroupable<Rule,Declaration>
implements Refinable, Named
    Represents a CSS declaration.

    See the notes on Refinable.

    See Also:
    DeclarationParser, PropertyValueParser

    • Constructor Detail

      • Declaration

        public Declaration(RawSyntax rawName,
                   RawSyntax rawValue)
        Creates a new Declaration with the given rawProperty (property name) and rawValue (property value).
        Parameters:
        rawName - The raw property name.
        rawValue - The raw property value.

      • Declaration

        public Declaration(Property propertyName,
                   PropertyValue propertyValue)
        Creates a new Declaration with the given PropertyName and PropertyValue.

        This should be used for dynamically created declarations.

        Example: 

          NumericalValue px10 = NumericalValue.of(10, "px");
   NumericalValue em5 = NumericalValue.of(5, "em");
   PropertyValue value = PropertyValue.ofTerms(OperatorType.SPACE, px10, em5);
   new Declaration(Property.BORDER_RADIUS, value)

        If there is only a single value then use Declaration(Property, Term) instead.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - The Property.
        propertyValue - The PropertyValue.

      • Declaration

        public Declaration(Property propertyName,
                   Term singleValue)
        Creates a new instance of a Declaration with the given Property and single Term value.

        This should be used for dynamically created declarations.

        Example: 

          new Declaration(Property.ZOOM, NumericalValue.of(1));
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The Property.
        singleValue - The single Term.

      • Declaration

        public Declaration(PropertyName propertyName,
                   Term singleValue)
        Creates a new instance of a Declaration with the given PropertyName and single Term value.

        This should be used for dynamically created declarations.

        Example: 

          PropertyName name = PropertyName.using("new-prop");
  new Declaration(name, NumericalValue.of(1));
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property name.
        singleValue - The single Term.

      • Declaration

        public Declaration(PropertyName propertyName,
                   PropertyValue propertyValue)
        Creates a new instance of a Declaration with the given PropertyName and PropertyValue.

        This should be used for dynamically created declarations.

        Example: 

          PropertyName prop = PropertyName.using(Property.BORDER_RADIUS).prefix(Prefix.WEBKIT);
   Declaration newDeclaration = new Declaration(prop, declaration.propertyValue());
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The PropertyName.
        propertyValue - The PropertyValue.

      • isProperty

        public boolean isProperty(String name)
        Gets whether this Declaration has the given property name. Prefer to use isProperty(Property) instead.

        Example: 

         if (declaration.isProperty("border-radius") {...}
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the property.
        Returns:
        True if this Declaration has the given property name.

      • isProperty

        Parameters:
        property - The Property.
        Returns:
        True of this Declaration has the given property name.

      • propertyValue

        public PropertyValue propertyValue()
        Gets the property value.

        Important: this may be an empty property value if this declaration is unrefined! See the main readme file for more information on refinement.

        For basic use cases, to ensure this is always refined and properly set use AutoRefine or StandardValidation during parsing. For reasons why you would not want to do that see the main readme file.

        Returns:
        The property value.

      • parentAtRule

        public Optional<AtRule> parentAtRule()
        Similar to AbstractGroupable.parent(), except this will return the parent's containing AtRule.

        This is only applicable for declarations directly within a Rule, directly within an AtRuleBlock, directly within an AtRule.

        Returns:
        The parent AtRule, or an empty Optional if not present or if the parent hierarchy doesn't match as described above.

      • shouldBreakBroadcast

        public boolean shouldBreakBroadcast(SubscriptionPhase phase)
        Description copied from interface: Broadcastable
        Gets whether an in-progress broadcast should be stopped.

        This might be true if a change of state or conditions of the unit result in the broadcast no longer being necessary during the given SubscriptionPhase.

        Specified by:
        shouldBreakBroadcast in interface Broadcastable
        Overrides:
        shouldBreakBroadcast in class AbstractSyntax
        Parameters:
        phase - The current SubscriptionPhase.
        Returns:
        True if in-progress broadcasting should be stopped.

      • propagateBroadcast

        public void propagateBroadcast(Broadcaster broadcaster,
                               Status status)
        Description copied from interface: Broadcastable
        Broadcasts or rebroadcasts all child units using the given Broadcaster.

        The broadcast will only occur for a unit if its Status matches the given Status.

        Implementers should call this on child units and SyntaxCollections first, then use the broadcaster to broadcast itself. All of this should be wrapped in a check to ensure the Status matches.

        Specified by:
        propagateBroadcast in interface Broadcastable
        Overrides:
        propagateBroadcast in class AbstractSyntax
        Parameters:
        broadcaster - Use this Broadcaster to broadcast all unbroadcasted child units.
        status - Broadcast units that have this status.

      • self

        protected Declaration self()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGroupable
        Should return "this". This is needed for property type access in the AbstractGroupable class.
        Specified by:
        self in class AbstractGroupable<Rule,Declaration>
        Returns:
        "this".

      • writesOwnComments

        public boolean writesOwnComments()
        Description copied from interface: Syntax
        Specifies whether this object will handle writing its own comments, instead of the automatic behavior of the StyleWriter.

        If returning true, be sure to check StyleWriter#shouldWriteAllComments() to determine if comments should actually be written out or not. The StyleWriter#appendComments(Iterable, StyleAppendable) utility method contains this logic and is the preferable way to handle it.

        Specified by:
        writesOwnComments in interface Syntax
        Overrides:
        writesOwnComments in class AbstractSyntax
        Returns:
        True if this object writes its own comments.

      • isWritable

        public boolean isWritable()
        Description copied from interface: Writable
        Returns whether this unit should actually be written.

        Usually this should just return true, however some units that are detachable or otherwise potentially invalid should first check their state and respond appropriately.

        Specified by:
        isWritable in interface Writable
        Overrides:
        isWritable in class AbstractGroupable<Rule,Declaration>
        Returns:
        True if the unit should be written.

      • write

        public void write(StyleWriter writer,
                  StyleAppendable appendable)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Writable
        Outputs this Writable's string representation.

        Important notes for implementation:

        Do not use the StyleWriter in an attempt to write direct content (Strings, chars, etc...). Use the StyleAppendable.

        The StyleWriter should be used to make decisions based on writer settings (e.g., compressed vs. verbose output mode), as well as for writing inner or child Writables. Do not call the this method method directly on inner or child Writables! That would bypass any overrides that are set on the StyleWriter. Use StyleWriter.writeInner(Writable, StyleAppendable) instead.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Writable
        Parameters:
        writer - Writer to use for output settings and for writing inner Writables.
        appendable - Append direct content to this StyleAppendable.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • copy

        public Declaration copy()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSyntax
        For implementations: do not copy comments or orphaned comments, instead be sure to call AbstractSyntax.copiedFrom(Syntax) on the new copy.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface Syntax
        Specified by:
        copy in class AbstractSyntax
        Returns:
        The new instance.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: Groupable
        Removes this unit from its collection. Use this method to remove a unit from the syntax tree.

        Once removed, the unit cannot be re-added to any collection, however it can still be copied. Destroyed units will no longer be broadcasted to any subsequent plugins.

        Specified by:
        destroy in interface Groupable<Rule,Declaration>
        Overrides:
        destroy in class AbstractGroupable<Rule,Declaration>
